RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The Hillshire Brands Company 

Storm Lake, Iowa



Background Data



In accordance with Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations Chapter 68 (40 CFR 68) promulgated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), The Hillshire Brands Company - Storm Lake (Hillshire Brands) submits this Risk Management Plan (RMP) for operations at their Storm Lake, Iowa facility.  Hillshire Brands - Storm Lake operations include slaughtering, de-boning, and some processing. Hillshire Brands - Storm Lake has been in operation at this facility for over 45 years providing quality meat products and over 650 jobs to the local community.



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policy



Hillshire Brands is committed to protecting the health of its employees, the surrounding community, and the environment. It is Hillshire Brands policy to maintain a safe and healthy workplace, protect the environment, and comply with all applicable regulations, including 40 CFR 68, as applicable. Accidental releases are kept small or eliminated and emergency response readiness is maintained through our processes implemented per requirements of these regulations.



Stationary Sources and Regulated Substances



Hillshire Brands is required to maintain low temperatures in the food processing areas of the plant that are within standards required by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) to ensure quality in the final products. Hillshire Brands also operates freezers and coolers for product storage.  Hillshire Brands uses anhydrous ammonia (the 112(r) regulated substance) as a refrigerant to maintain the facility within the required range of operating temperatures and to operate the freezers and coolers. Anhydrous ammonia is an industry-standard refrigerant for meat processing plants. Hillshire Brands' refrigeration system, consisting of receivers, compressors, evaporators, condensers, and piping, contains over 10,000 pounds of anhydrous amm

onia. 



Accidental Release Prevention Program



To prevent and mitigate accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia, Hillshire Brands has implemented certain precautionary measures, including process / equipment controls, procedures, preventative maintenance programs, employee training and auditing.  In addition, Hillshire Brands' ammonia refrigeration system is designed and constructed in accordance with accepted industry standards and good engineering practices. 



Hillshire Brands has also developed and implemented a PSM program pursuant to OSHA regulations and as such, has evaluated the system for the potential of anhydrous ammonia releases. Some of the controls installed to prevent catastrophic releases of ammonia are process equipment (pressure relief valves, backup pumps, and manual shutoffs) and automated controls (automatic level controls and automatic process shutdown).  In addition, Hillshire Brands has trained approximately 20 personnel to respond to potential ammonia releases (HAZWOPER team).



Hillshire Brands has developed standard operating procedures for all employees and contractors that have contact with the ammonia refrigeration system that incorporate safety measures into the procedures.  These safety procedures were developed by refrigeration system operators and are reviewed on an annual basis.  Hillshire Brands encourages employee participation in development of the control measures used at the plant by means of company newsletters, employee participation meetings, and training sessions.  Pursuant to written management of change procedures established by Hillshire Brands, any changes to the operating procedures are to be communicated to affected employees.



Hillshire Brands understands that maintaining the refrigeration system in good working order is essential to preventing accidental releases; therefore Hillshire Brands has implemented a preventative maintenance program.  The preventative maintenance program is scheduled, documented and

managed using a computer maintenance management software system to ensure that regular maintenance occurs on the system, while ensuring the mechanical integrity of critical refrigeration system components.



To ensure that Hillshire Brands' control measures are effective in maintaining the safe operation of the plant, regularly scheduled audits are performed on the ammonia refrigeration system.  In accordance with the PSM program, an independent source conducts a detailed PSM compliance audit at least every three years. It incorporates a review of process safety information, process hazard analysis, operating procedures, training programs, system mechanical integrity, management of change, pre-start up review procedures, compliance audit procedures, incident investigation procedures, employee participation programs, hot work permit procedures, and contractor safety procedures.



Five-Year Accident History



Over the last five years, Hillshire Brands - Storm Lake has not experienced an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia causing any on-site death, injury or significant propery damage, or known off-site death, injury, property damage, environmental damage, off site evacuations or sheltering in place.



Emergency Response Program



Hillshire Brands has documented emergency response procedures in a document entitled EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN in order to facilitate response efforts in the event of an off-site anhydrous ammonia release.  Included in the plan are measures to be taken internally by Hillshire Brands personnel who are trained in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.120, OSHA's Hazardous Operations and Emergency Response regulations according to their duties and function.  These personnel receive initial training and annual refresher training thereafter.  As an additional training exercise, a simulation of an emergency release is conducted on an annual basis. 



To assure that the local governmental response agencies are familiar with Hillshire Brands emergenc

y response procedures, Hillshire Brands has submitted copies of the plan for review by the local agencies.  The following local agencies have reviewed Hillshire Brands plan:



Emergency Management Coordinator



Department of Public Safety



To plan for an ammonia release with off-site effects, Hillshire Brands' plan includes procedures/equipment to mitigate the release, procedures to inform local response agencies, transportation maps for response agencies, evacuation route maps, and procedures for public communication.



In the event of an anhydrous ammonia release with off-site effects, the general public will be warned using the following methods:



Sirens



Broadcast message via the local cable television system



Police and fire vehicles equipped with public address systems, and



Door-to-door notification of residents (if deemed necessary).



As backup measures, Hillshire Brands has arranged emergency response assistance with a clean-up contractor.



Continuing Efforts to Improve Safety



As part of Hillshire Brands' continuous efforts to improve the safety of the system, changes are planned at the facility to improve safety and prevent anhydrous ammonia releases. These changes include improvements to operating procedures, increased protection of ammonia equipment, and increased ammonia safety training.
